title: Elderly couple proves matching outfits can be cute, not creepy | New York Post
text:

A post shared by bon_pon (@bonpon511) on Feb 27, 2017 at 12:23am PST 
Dressing like your significant other is often a surefire way to inspire eye-rolls and ridicule â€” see Britney Spearsâ€™ and Justin Timberlakeâ€™s matching denim-on-denim ensembles , which will live on forever in infamy.
But one elderly couple has managed to turn their twinning into social- media gold.
Known on Instagram as @bonpon511 â€” a combination of their first names and their wedding anniversary, according to the Daily Mail â€” this Japanese husband-and-wife duo has amassed more than 100,000 followers in just three months with shots of their craftily coordinated wardrobes.
IKEAã«è¡Œãã¨ãã¯é’ã„æœã‚’ç€ãŸããªã‚Šã¾ã™ #couple #over60 #fashion #coordinate #outfit #ootd #instafashion #instaoutfit #instagramjapan #whitehair #silverhair #greyhair #å¤«å©¦ #60ä»£ #ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ #ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆ #ã‚°ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ˜ã‚¢ #ç™½é«ª #å…±ç™½é«ª 
A post shared by bon_pon (@bonpon511) on Dec 8, 2016 at 8:08pm PST 
Married for almost 37 years, the fashion-forward couple wear matching outfits every day. If one wears a blue gingham dress, the other will wear a blue checkered shirt. If one wears a Tartan overcoat with a fair isle sweater, the other will compliment the outfit with a slightly different colored fair isle sweater and matching Tartan kilt. The two tend to stick to a neutral palette of black, white and gray, shot with bright red or blue, or enlivened with plaid or polka dots. And they deftly mix avant-garde labels like Comme des Garcons with basics from Uniqlo as well as vintage finds.

A post shared by bon_pon (@bonpon511) on Feb 12, 2017 at 12:17am PST 
But itâ€™s not just their meticulous ensembles that attract fans. The pair clearly have a sweet whimsy that comes through in their photos, which often depict them posing in rabbit-eared hats or next to unicorn sculptures.
â€œYou guys are such an inspiration,â€ wrote one commenter . â€œI love it; you both have probably so much fun.â€
